column5: Has anyone ever purchased insurance on the boat and motor you rent from the resort? If so where did you buy it.
generally the resort owner has a little rider that covers the equipment for 50 or a hundred dollors. it all depends how lucky you feel bucky!

I would assume that the resort owner does not have a rider on his insurance, but is self insuring. As odd as it seems, insurance companies do not offer a rider that the customer can pay for to insure the equipment separately from the resort's insurance. Not affecting the resort's "experience rating". Another thing you could look into is to what extent your own homeowner's policy will help. I know of a number of people that were able to file claims with their own companies, to reimburse the resort for damage done to rented boats. Frank Walsh

[font color=green size=3][b]Generaly your homeowners will cover damage to rented equipment, but in this day and age you probably won't want to file unless it's serious $$. Being a careful with the equipment would be easier.
